name: Michael Winters
text: I read some of the older reviews and as far back as a year ago people said the ac was broken and it still is. Credit card machine still doesn’t work. Half the fans are broken and/or missing blades. Very very run down, old and not cared for in years. Bowling alleys are meant to be sketchy but this was a whole different level. Men’s bathroom stalls are handmade and the walls are about chest high so if you are peeing at a urinal and someone is dropping a log you dont have any privacy. Make sure not to wear your “Bowlling” shoes outside. The employees were bowling next to us in crocs and street shoes...

text: Surprisingly good food and super friendly staff. Pins get a little wonky sometimes but this is an older alley. I do love this place! Two dollar games on Wednesday? Can't beat it!!

text: Great people kind rough prices and not a lot of the lanes work. We had to switch lanes luckily they gave us another game but still fact is I wouldn't bring a big party here. Very nice people though I don't know if I would go back .

name: Daniel Spears
text: Lane we bowled and lane beside us did not work, had to press reset button after each bowl,not person but each bowl. When it did reset and gather pins it may set all pins for the next bowler or you may get what was not knocked over from previous bowler. No refund and did not bother them that it was doing it. Go somewhere else if possible.

name: Brandy Gann
text: This place is disgraceful. Every aspect of our trip was unpleasant. From the second we walked in the door we were greeted with industrial fans instead of air conditioning which of course made speaking to each other very difficult. We proceeded to pay the awful woman behind the counter $24 Plus for four games. The floors were sticky so that our shoes would not slide properly. We managed to make it through the first 2 games and decided to step outside to smoke. The woman from behind the counter immediately followed us outside to inform us that it was 11:00 pm and they were closing at 11. I asked for a refund and she say no but shed let us finish our games. Wht would you sell us 4 games if we only had time to play two...silly.  so then every employee sat behind us watching/hurrying us to complete our game. The woman behind the counter even came and started with me as if to start an argument.  We will NOT be going back to this establishment. The only bright spots in this place was the bartender who was very pleasant and the manager Roger who was very personable and kind.

name: Erin “Ginger the MovieStar” Mahaffey-Ragland
text: This place is absolutely horrible. It looks like a train wreck. My man and I have tried to go there for date night a couple of times and got to play 1 game an hour due to the fact that everything is broken! Don’t even think about going to the restroom ladies! We are in serious need of a good bowling alley. Good money to be made in this area for the person who does it!!

name: Jacob Burrell
text: The lanes are sub par. The machines chip and scratch up your ball. There is never oil on the lanes. Half the lanes don't work. The pin setters don't always work. The only reason I keep going there is because there isn't anywhere in the county to bowl. Someone please build a bowling alley!

text: Definitely needs an upgrade. Really would love to see this place boom since it's really the only one in our area. Computers malfunction alot of the time.

text: The staff was very hateful.  Staff was harassing everyone in the place about every little thing.  Kids not allowed to stand up and watch the game.  Was not allowed to have my drink down by the bowling area.  Nobody allowed near the bowling area unless you were playing and had shoes on.  That means nobody was allowed to sit and watch with your family.  Very un-enjoyable experience and will not return.

text: The staff is phenomenal. Yes, the lanes need updating, the oil should be applied more often... But you will not find any place friendly and willing to help your game..

text: The woman working today was extremely rude! She would not make a child an order of french fries and wouldn't let kids have the bumpers up. The building is absolutely disgusting and a health concern with leaking water and the ceiling falling in. Will not be back.

text: The employees were attentive and willing to help. My friends little girl had her birthday party here and they provided table cloths, plates, napkins, and forks as well as a few drinks.

name: haiden beshears
text: Honestly this is the worst experience I’ve ever had. For starters we walked into the place at 9:50pm took some time and then went up and got a lane for an hour, we were told to stop bowling at 10:45pm. How you walk into somewhere at one time, pay for an hour and then are told to stop bowling before the hour is beyond me. Second, there is no air conditioning and it’s 80 degrees outside. Hotter inside than outside. Pouring sweat 10 minutes in. And our lane messed up several times and we had to wait while they fixed our lane for a few minutes. This place is outdated and severely overpriced for what you get out of it. Either update or shut down because it’s pointless to be open in that condition.

text: Horrible service. Pins did not all come down had to press reset button after every bowl. Kept complaining about the issue but they do not care. $50 huge waste. Will never go back!!

text: This should be a negative review, but I went with a group of people and we asked for 3 lanes and he wouldn't give us any because "he said so." He said that we'd have to pay for 2 hours rather than just 1, and the man that talked with us was completely rude. He did not want to help us in any way. Bowling is a recreational activity that's supposed to be fun, but we ended up leaving because of his attitude. The majority of us were gay, so he might have been homophobic, but the people before us got a lane for 1 hour and for some reason he couldn't allow us to do the same?? He was rude, unreasonable and a bigot. Trashy environment. Trashy bowling guy. Sorry not sorry.

name: Joey Duncan
text:
This should be in a negative review category.
First off there is no ventilation and the place wreaks of decades of cigarette smoke and urine.
it is about 100 degrees in there.
All of the balls are marred up, which should have been my warning, more on this in a second.
They keep the "Cosmic" bowling going all of the time, so you do not notice how disgusting the place is. Pretty sure it has never been cleaned.
Back to the balls being Marred up. I stupidly brought my own balls and on my 3rd frame my towel got snagged on something as i was cleaning the ball, my primary hook ball. There was about a 1/2 inch chunk missing from my ball. The ball return had apparently gashed it. I brought it to the person appearing to be in charge, i will call ODB from here on,and the reply was,
"Just keep using it, I will have him check the return."
my reply was "You don't understand this is my ball and that gash was nopt there before i came here"
ODB: "We can fix that just leave it with us a while, We will do it cheap too."
I could go on but you likely can see this is not going well. Needless to say i politely as possible declined to leave the ball and will take it to have it repaired. And chalk this up to a learning experience.

name: Dallas Reese
text: I was able to play here last Saturday with some family. What an awesome place. We came with a group of 11. The owner is super friendly and was extremely accommodating to a large, unruly group. (Hey! I have to give my In-laws a hard time.) The owner actually came out and played against us and soundly beat us. This is the real deal. Real lasers and not RF (radio frequency). The "battleground" is well laid out and has a ton of room to maneuver. There are some "tricky" twists in the form of "bases," but you need to go play to find out about that. I highly recommend this as a great group, individual, or family outing. There were kids and adults playing with us. The game is monitored by security cameras, so that is an added safety feature. We have needed a place like this in Prattville for a long time. I would give this place more stars if that was an option. Thanks to the owner for giving us such a wonderful time. Please go try it out for your self! Not overly expensive, fun, entertaining, and an awesome time almost guaranteed. Support Local!

resp.text: Thank you. I hope to see all of you again!!!

name: Sara Mosier
text:
I've been here twice with my roommates, both times for their children's birthday parties.

The first time was around Aug 2020, and it was pretty dead in the bowling alley.  We were the only customers in there for at least the first hour.  We purchased the 2 hour package, which you get to choose your food from a list, you get several arcade play cards with tokens and a laminated bowling pin for the birthday child.   Any food you don't finish, they allow you to box up and take with you!

Surprisingly,  the food is actually really good.  We had chicken tenders, pizza, and mac n cheese balls the first time, and cheesy bread, chicken tenders and buffalo cauliflower this last time.

The second time we went, which was this month, they were a LOT busier but the experience was still pretty amazing.  Bottom line, both children loved their birthday parties and we would do this for either of them again!

resp.text: Sara thank you for the five-star review about our Bowlero! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

text: Jarred was awesome at having the party run smoothly and enjoyable. The staff ensured we had enough napkins & drink refills & gave us the plates for the cake. I celebrated my daughter's 10th birthday here. They let her do two song requests. They had the bumpers up etc. They even added our guest's names for us in the system as they all arrived. We had our own private area. The pizza was filling & delicious. They had set up Happy Birthday with my daughter's name. I have zero complaints. 100% fully satisfied customer. Booking was easy. The staff answered all questions & accommodated our needs perfectly to our desires. I look forward to coming again. Each child in the party also had a $3 complimentary arcade card which was very much enjoyed after bowling. We are very grateful for our positive experience. Honestly, my expectations were exceeded. Way to go Bowlero. Thank you!  I would definitely recommend this bowling alley for any age or event.

They also give a great military discount, which I appreciated it!

Next, we cannot start the game because the bumpers are not electronic. I was able to run to Target and back before they got the bumpers up. Of course, everyone has to use bumpers, which is lame. Do not come here. What a waste.

We had to ask several times who we were talking g to and they just kept demanding to speak with my wife by name. I can safely say I will not be using this company again and I advise other to stay away and book your party with a different company.

The food is a bit expensive but well worth it.

text: This place is 10 times better now after they remodeled it. Very nice and tons of room now, the arcade was enjoyed by the kids and we all had a blast at laser tag. However, for a family of four it gets ridiculously expensive to bowl, get snacks or almost anything else. About the only time we go now is when Groupon has sales. If it was more affordable it would have been 5 stars.

name: Emily Heim
text: Great bowling center. The food and drinks are high priced so be prepared. The bathrooms are clean. The arcade is really good. Definitely enjoy coming every year for Pepsi Qualifying.

name: Christina Stanbro
text: DO NOT ORDER THE BUFFALO WINGS. They come straight from the fiery pits of hell and will only haunt you while you bowl. Had fun

name: Dan Taylor
text:
My wife and I went along with another couple for a couple of games of late night bowling on a Saturday night.

I have bowled for many years and I've been to many different bowling alleys.

I was impressed with the size and amount of lanes this location had and definitely the house ball selection for those who don't have their own ball. We hadn't planned on visiting the bowling alley while we were in town so I used a house ball this particular evening. The balls are arranged by weight and not just thrown in random spots.

There are large screens with graphics for each lane to keep you entertained.  The location has a bar, arcade, and pool table. The staff was friendly. We'll be going back soon.

name: Mel R.
text: Nice. Clean. Game area was cool. Wait time was a bit much, especially since there were over 10 lanes unoccupied. Supposed tournament, but there wasn't any tournament happening. 😕

name: Chris Nesbit
text: Very good lanes. Service was great.

name: ronald massey
text: My wife and I, our daughter and our grandson, 5 years old, spent the evening. And had a great time. It is family oriented people will very helpful and got to talk with others and meet others.

name: Cody Tillery
text:
We went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm. We ordered a hotdog,hamburger, and a shrimp popper meal which took a whole hour to get to us.
It seems like there were only 4 people working with many of the lanes full. I don't know if people called out but management should have found fill ins instead of running their employees ragged.
We had a much better experience coming here on a Saturday night than a less busy Sunday afternoon.

name: CARLOS ANDERSON
text: Customer service is lacking here. The lane I was on kept having issues and it took forever for the STAFF to respond and address the matter.

name: Ed Higdon
text: The place was fine but we had a set time frame in which to bowl. Not a big deal to get a couple games in before the time ran out, except for the fact that the lane quit working a number of times. Changing lanes didn't seem to matter for the people who started next to us because they moved from a lane that kept messing up to a lane that was messing up worse. That said, we decided to take our chances. Several times it took the staff as much as 10-12 minutes to get it working again because more than once I watched them hanging out chatting with other employees at the desk for more than 5 minutes after being told it had quit again. We didn't have any issues with the lanes at the other place in town so we went there a couple times more recently. It cost less with a groupon anyway I believe.

name: Selena Manning
text: The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

name: Ethan Winters
text: Very fun and entertaining place. Music on projectors in back of bowling alleys is a plus. Lazertag course is top of the line and they even have tourneys! First time we went the lazer tag was unoperational but the manager gave us free passes to lazer tag and a gift card with 10 free credits to the arcade! The college student special for bowling was an extreme help considering me and my friends were on a budget. Extremely friendly staff and lots of cool stuff to do. Cheap prices make this a very enjoyable outing and i will definitely be visiting again. 100/10 would reccomend.

name: Matt Malecki
text: You get, what you expecting and more.

name: jess horton
text:
Pros: front desk staff was super nice, place was clean, and had well kept bathrooms. Lanes and decor were nice. Price was decent for three games and shoes about $15.

Cons: Waitress was a hot mess. Food was weird - got the garlic parmesan wings that tasted like they were buffalo wings fist then someone threw bit of extra seasoning on them. Also got the sample plate with no cheese bread. Took FORVEVE to get drinks.

text: This is where my family goes for good clean fun.

name: John Stanley
text: Awesome time and even better specials!!! A must go!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Overall was a good experience! They spaced you out in lanes which was nice til it was busy. We of course went with kids so it was a bit crazy. Ordered food and was quick as it could be as it was getting busy but with just the one waitress she was so overloaded with people she was slow the busier it got but she def did her best.
The bowling was fun. We didn't play arcade games that day but want to go back to play as they looked fun.

name: Baylee F
text: We went around 5 on Saturday. The employee working the front desk was very rude, didnt greet or speak to either my husband or I, only spoke to tell us to put our card in the chip reader. There were maybe only 7 other lanes in use at this point so they were NOT busy by any means. Went to order 2 drinks and an order of fries around 5:40 and the bar wasnt set up yet I guess? So we ended up waiting over 20 minutes for that order. The place is nice and clean but the staff SERIOUSLY needs to be talked to about customer service. We were completely ignored when we tried to check out as well until a girl walked by (despite there being people behind the desk ignoring us) and asked if we needed to be checked out. We wont be returning, definitely going to try out a different alley next time.

name: Steve Burns
text: Great bowling alley.  Hosts the Pepsi Tournament annually and does a great job.   Large game area, and laser tag room.  Was given a tour of the facility by a friendly and knowledgeable associate. The only negative was extremely slow lane conditioning machines, but that only occurs before tournaments and leagues and does not affect open bowling.

name: Randall Colwell
text: First of all I haven't been here since it was Peach Bowl Lanes and boy was I in for a treat. This place looks and feels amazing. So to get to my experience we scheduled a King Pin Party Package here if you don't know what that is it's amazing what you get for you buck. We had an wonderful time bowling, great food and someone who actually knows how to make good mix drinks lol thanks bartenders. We want to get a BIG Shout Out to our lane server Michaela. She was on top of our party from start to finish never once did we have to search for her and very friendly A+++ service. Our second BIG Shout Out is to the Manager Lorenzo. We had a couple hiccups throughout the night nothing major but he was on top of it and made sure we had the best experience ever, we appreciate that man. Third an last shout out is to the man that set this all up for me over the phone Mr. John Cole. Without you and all your guidance and emails we would have never had this experience. Thanks again. If your looking for a good time and are over the age of 21 and wanna do a group event totally look into the King Pin Package here. I promise you that you won't regret the decision. Want to Thank the Bowlero of Columbus Ga for a great experience. Thank you all.

name: C Policastro
text:
Very large inside and can hold lots of people, great place for parties and hanging out. Bowling is a little expensive when there aren't any specials, at 2 games for $14 that's more than I'm used to spending. But the lanes and balls are in great shape and had no issues, except the lane we played in the 1 pin would fall down about 40% of the time after a reset, so our scores were a bit messed up.

The laser tag is a good size for maybe 5v5, any more and it's chaos unless you just want to sit still and not move around. The guns are clean and "cool" looking and are easy to use and you know when you aren't holding it right when it beeps so it won't shoot.

The bar area is decent size and staff was super friendly and quick service. There was only 1 dart in the board so we couldn't play darts.

I would visit again and bowl just when the games were cheaper.

name: Cory Germain
text: Friendly staff, great burgers, and affordable bowling in a clean environment. Thanks for a fun time!

name: Miguel Villanueva
text: I was very impressed with the taste of the cheeseburger. Very good seasoning. The fries were hot and tasty as well. The place is clean and the service was good. They had an "all you can bowl" for $5 special going on and sadly enough no more than 8 lanes were being used. Not sure if it's advertised on base. They even have an ice cream parlor called "Scoops". They ran out of chocolate though :-( In any case, it's a must visit place when at Maxwell to have fun and eat. I'll drop by tomorrow to see if the chocolate ice cream arrived.

name: Emily Gayle
text: Great place to go with your family for inside fun. When first seeing the outside of the building it looks run down and you will wonder if indeed it is going to be the same way inside. But once you open the doors everything is nice and updated. The screens showing the scores were entertaining and the place was clean. Would recommend it. My three year old had a great time.

name: TJ Lewis
text: The staff were very friendly, however, there weren't many staff members. It was a Saturday night yet there were only two employees working most of the night. I waited over an hour and a half before getting my food because they were so backed up. However, they did give it to me for free because of the wait. The bowling lanes are quite used and they repeatedly got jammed or had other errors and had to be reset. The prices are very affordable though; we bowled two games and only paid $6.50 per person including shoe rentals.

name: Катрин Хаджицинова
text: My lovely place for every monday, time for beer and french fries or pizza with friends, have fun time with bowling!

name: EmJay Elle
text: Great staff! Excellent food! We always have a wonderful experience when we go!

name: J Tucker
text: It's a shame that we came at an odd time with staff quitting mid shift and technical problems. They have alternate "games" that you dont get your monies worth so stick to the regular bowling. If the staff up the place and have better cooks and stop running out of draft beer it would be better.

text: Nice little bowling alley. The cook hates her life and hates her job. But other than that, fun little place to relax and have fun.

text:
Excellent. Great alley, great specials
Nice employees  love the decor

name: Grant Cooper
text: An old-timey themed lane that hasn't changed its stylish decor or music since the 1980's. It is fairly well-kept and the staff are usually helpful and cheerful. The food is good, especially the ice cream, which is served from its own dedicated counter.

name: Wes S
text: This is a great facility and they have some great deals if you check out their promotions.  The best is on Wednesday evenings (starting at 4 I think), they have $1 games, shoes, hot-dogs, and drinks.  I can take my whole family for a couple games of bowling and dinner for $20.  The facility is super clean, lanes are high quality, and they've got fairly new bowling balls, including as low as 5 pound balls for kids (they keep them to the left and rear of the counter, so you have to know where to look).

name: Fred Michaud
text: Decent food, cooked to order. Lots of choices. Good lanes that are well maintained.

name: Scot Dyess
text: Bowl 2 games for free with a combo purchase.  Woohoo!

name: large marge
text: Used to be decent place to eat lunch now it sucks so bad. The lady who works behind the counter sees me and ignores me as long as she can and then when she decides to help me she will not even look at me or speak to me. It takes her 5 minutes to figure out how the register works and then she hands me the receipt and turns around and walks away. EVERY TIME. We go off base to eat now where we are treated better.

text: Good environment, nice people I enjoyed that place with friends and family!!!

name: Kelito Smith
text: I can only give them 3 stars due to the fact that I ONLY get my breakfast from the bowling center. And another reason is due to the fact of the lady who cooks in the morning. Sometimes I don’t have to say anything the ones special cook knows my order off top. And some mornings you’re like What the heck is going on? The White lady didn’t wash her hands nor had on any gloves. FML. But may the odds be in your favor. Ok food for a bowling center.

name: Jamaal Grooms
text: Cheap price and a lot of fun if you strictly bowling...no arcades

name: Mark D
text: All we wanted to do was go bowling, drink a couple of beers, and snack on some junk food.  Unfortunately this didn't happen fully on either of the Saturdays that we went there.  The first time we went the cool never showed up meaning we couldn't have any food.  I tried to get a milk shake at their ice cream stand and they were out of milk.  The next time we went the two guys working the kitchen felt overwhelmed so they shutdown 1.5 hours early and even stopped serving drinks.  Pretty sad operation here.  Definitely need some more managerial oversight and to take lessons from other successfully operated AF bowling lanes.

name: S L
text: Nice bowling lane, but they don't sync up their advertisements with the FSS. Went in after seeing one of the FSS sponsored combo deals only to discover it was last month's.

text: Hey I love this bowling alley it was cleaning service and friendly staff was really really friendly that Keep sterilized and clean and everybody was Nice and friendly I'm asking friends in there off my Facebook first time we ever met face to face I recommend this place to everybody it's not that high either the prices are great they have a bar in the room by your beer and price on that cheap and we had a wonderful time and I want to thank my son and my daughter-in-law for taking us and paying our way I'm about to see my nephew Corporal Michael Fred Hudgins they he has really grown up he's going on his mid 20s now and he has already retired from the Marines good marks the best Marksman they ever had and it was won a lot of metals and he's giving them to me just got to go get them and one condition he never has to see him again well I guess he has some pretty bad experience over there but he can't talk about it but anyway we had a great time for bowling alley me and him got no bible discussion and I didn't think I could pick those balls up I haven't bowled in 25 years but hey I almost got two stripes I did pretty decent and I like to go again and I will go again cuz I had fun I recommend this place to everybody
